description:
2/1/2024 – at around 6:43 p.m. near the intersection of NE 21st Avenue and NE Montgomery Street.  
This crash involved a vehicle versus a pedestrian with serious  injuries.  
Weather was unknown.  
The pedestrian was skateboarding southbound along the center line. They said a car approached from  
behind them southbound, so they tried to cross at a diagonal angle in a southeasterly direction to avoid this 
vehicle and was struck by the vehicle .   
 
 The driver said they were traveling at approximately 25 miles per hour north on NE 21st Ave when 
suddenly,  they struck a pedestrian on a skateboard. They did not see the pedestrian until the  incident 
occurred and did not have any chance on avoiding the collision. The driver said the pedestrian seemed  as if 
they were attempting to cross the street and did not see the vehicle approach.  

A witness stated they were traveling south on NE 21st Ave and witnessed two subjects riding their skateboards in the middle of the road. The witness stated they observed a vehicle traveling northbound, the witness attempted to honk to signal the two indivi duals of the incoming vehicle.  
 The witness said the skateboarder closest to the middle of the road was struck by the vehicle which they then proceeded to pull over and check on the individual . 
 Observation and measurements at crash scene did not indicate high speed as a factor in this crash.  
 Staff visited the location and found that lighting does exist at the location and did not find any obvious crash factors that would have led to the crash.  

No citations related to the crash were issued.

1/22/2024 – at around 8:19 p.m. near the intersection of NE 10th Avenue and E Main Street.  
 
This crash involved a vehicle versus a bicyclist with minor injuries.  
 
Weather was unknown.  
 
The driver said they were driving north on NE 10th Avenue and attempted to make a right hand turn onto E 
Main Street. The driver said the bicyclist was heading south on NE 10th Avenue and crossing the 
intersection of E Main Street. The driver believed the bicyclist had gone against the pedestrian traffic control device due to the westbound traffic on E Main Street having a green turn arrow .  
 
The bicyclist sated they were not paying attention and knew they were going against the pedestrian signal 
and admitted the crash was their fault.  
 A witness came forth and said they were the first vehicle in the left turn lane on E Main Street, waiting to turn south on SE 10
th Avenue when the bicyclist had come from their right and crossing in front of their 
vehicle as their left turn light had turned green.    
 Staff did not visit the crash location .  
 No citations were issued.

2/10/2024 – at around 4:08 p.m.  at the intersection of SE 10th Avenue and SE Gumleaf Lane.

 This crash involved a vehicle versus a bicyclist with fatal injuries.  
 Weather was cloudy and pavement surface was dry.   
  
Investigation is still ongoing. However what staff knows so far is that a vehicle was traveling south on SE 
10th and turned right onto SE Gumleaf from SE 10 th Ave. Between the Starbucks and the Walgreens. The 
juvenile bicyclist was traveling north on the sidewalk approaching the intersection of SE Gumleaf when they 
were  struck by the car and ran over.   Driver remained on scene and said they never saw the bi cyclist . 
 Staff has not visit ed the crash location.  
 
Unknow if citations were issued.

2/13/2024 – at around 4:00 p.m.  at the intersection of NE 28th Avenue and E Main Street.  
 
This crash involved a vehicle versus a juvenile pedestrian  with serious  injuries.  
 
Weather unknown.  
 
Crash is still under investigation. What was reported is that the  toddler child was with its mother selling 
valentines in the church parking lot on NE 28th. Witness statements report that the child ran \sprinted 
straight into the road without looking and was struck by a passing truck. Driver stayed on scene and 
cooperated with all aspects of the investigation.   Child was  taken by life flight and will recover.   Injuries 
were a collapsed lung and some broken ribs.  
 Staff did not visit crash location.
